revised_title: The Relation between Maximum Work, Time of Lifting, and Weights Lifted by the Arms
tldr: This article presents a series of experiments conducted to understand the relationship between the maximum work done, the time of lifting, and the weights lifted by the arms. The author, Samuel Haughton, found that there is a specific time of lift at which the maximum work is done, and this time varies with the weight being lifted. The results suggest that the cubic equation derived from the law of fatigue represents the relationship between these factors, with the time of lift increasing with the weight but not proportionally.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Human Physiology
